p: Quercetin also protected mice fed a high-fat diet from endothelial dysfunction caused by oxidants and protected apolipoprotein E-knockout mice from atherosclerosis [ 88]. Some studies have shown that quercetin positively influences the development of the embryo, foetus, and placenta. Since this flavonoid has no teratogenic and miscarriage effects, it is generally considered safe. Therefore, in this risk group, its potential use in the prevention and treatment of pregnancy-induced hypertension syndrome has received much research attention [ 89â€“ 91].
